title: RedNorvo,CharlesMingus,TalFarlow trio/VJC 1950
description:
This gig for Mingus and Tal Farlow launched their famed careers in music.





"At first Mingus thought he was rusty.  He hadn't been playing, he'd been carrying 

mail.  He used to say, "I don't think I can do it.  I haven't been playing enough."

Well, it was the same way with Tal when he first came to work with me.  Tal used

to quit every night.  He'd say, "I can't play that fast.  I can't play like you do.

I'm not used to playing in that tempo!"  I said, "Tal, as a trio, we don't have

drums or any volume control like that.  For loudness or softness we've got to use

speed as our main device.  To finish the set we've got to use pacing."" .......

......Red Norvo      (excerpted from included text)


NOTE:  I've excluded the last 3 tracks because they are not of this trio...fA



*******************************************************************************



MY CRITERIA FOR UPLOADS (in order of importance)


1)  Is it duplication?

2)  Do I love this "album?"

3)  How good is the sound quality?

4)  Does this music have interesting historical significance?




Who has the time to listen to music which isn't extraordinary in some 

important way? ........fA
